sponsor.partnerMessage: DreamMaker Bath & Kitchen is a local, woman-owned, design and build company with national recognition. Not only do they do complete contracting and remodeling of your dream kitchen or bath, but they also do the design work too! Contact them today to get started on your project or stop by their Design Center.

posts.title: Finding The Best Christmas Lights In Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
From top to bottom, Northwest Arkansas is covered with amazing Christmas lights displays, and Macaroni Kid has put together a list to get you started on your tour-de-holiday-lights.

  • Light up the night: From the amazing displays at the Bentonville and Fayetteville Squares to neighborhoods where families go full-on-Clark-Griswold, this list is a great compilation of some of the region's best light displays.
  • Map it out: Easily plan your light tour with this map of the Best Decorated Christmas Homes and Lights in Northwest Arkansas.

Find the full list HERE.

posts.title: Be A Local Hero With Pedal It Forward
posts.content:
Pedal It Forward is on a mission to spread the joy of having a bicycle for health, recreation, and transportation by collecting, repairing, and distributing free or low-cost bikes to those in need across Northwest Arkansas

  • Join the ride: Get involved by donating a bike, volunteering repair skills, or giving monetarily; generally, $25 covers the repair and delivery of one bike for a neighbor in need!
  • Make a difference: Become a Pedal Hero by committing to give $25 or more monthly, and you'll receive an exclusive Pedal Hero t-shirt and monthly updates from the Pedal It Forward team!

Sign up to be a Pedal Hero HERE.

posts.title: Parking Reform In Fayetteville Gives New Life To Old Buildings
posts.content:
Before Feed and Folly became one of the coolest rooftop bars in Fayettville, the building on S College Ave sat vacant for almost 40 years due to commercial parking requirements that rendered the space unusable.

  • Renewed: Feed and Folly is just one success story resulting from Fayetteville's decision to remove commercial parking requirements citywide that formerly made spaces like this impossible to redevelop.
  • Priorities: Another benefit of eliminating parking minimums citywide has been reducing time spent processing parking variances and freeing up city staff to work on more important matters.

Read the full article by Congress for New Urbanism HERE.

posts.title: Razorbacks Women's Basketball Climbs In AP Poll
posts.content:
Razorbacks Women's Basketball has had a phenomenal start to the season, holding a 13-0 record and ranked No. 17 in the AP Top 25 Poll.

  • Jump shot: The Razorbacks saw a four-spot jump in the polls after their 83-75 win on Saturday against the previously No. 16 Creighton.
  • Wrapping up: Before heading into conference play, the team will play two games at the San Diego Invitational, tipping off today at 3p against No. 16 Oregon, followed by either No. 3 Ohio State or USF on Wednesday, Dec 21.

Read more about Razorback Women's Basketball HERE.

posts.title: Springdale Adopts Update For Downtown Master Plan
posts.content:
Springdale City Council recently accepted the Downtown Springdale Master Plan Update, which will guide the development of Downtown Springdale for the next 5-7 years as it aims to become a vibrant community for businesses and residents.

  • Review and revise: The update brings fresh clarity and establishes new priorities based on the success of the 2015 Downtown Master Plan.
  • Getting focused: The primary focus of the update is housing, parking, art, infrastructure improvements, and the integration of the Luther George Park Expansion and Jones Center Campus Renovation projects into the urban fabric of Downtown Springdale. 

View the complete Master Plan Update HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Pick
pick.content:
• Spick and span: The NEAT Method offers NWA Daily subscribers a free consultation for their organization services, packing assistance, and holiday decor takedown.*
  • Scaling up: Tech startup SupplyPike is relocating its headquarters from Fayetteville to the Northgate Plaza in Rogers.
  • Remembered: People lined the streets of Bentonville early Sunday to pay respects to Benton County Detective Paul Newell, who tragically died in a traffic accident while serving as a Wreaths Across America escort.
  • Full hearts: Members of the Springdale Rotary Club packed and distributed 1,200 bags of food for students at Jones Elementary School.
  • Defense: Arkansas welcomes Travis Williams as the Razorbacks' new defensive coordinator.
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
